[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: get_token_data_handle()] [Missing field panic] The code chains multiple .get() and .as_str() calls with ? operators - can missing nested fields cause silent None returns that mask critical data corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: get_tokens_handle()] [TokenStore missing] If the account never initialized a TokenStore resource, does returning None cause subsequent operations to fail gracefully or lead to unexpected panics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: get_collection_data()] [Hex parsing vulnerability] The AccountAddress::from_hex_literal() can fail - does the error message leak sensitive information about internal state or handle format? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: get_collection_data()] [Wrong creator attack] Can an attacker query collection data using a different creator address than the actual creator, potentially accessing collections they shouldn't see? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: get_collection_data()] [Type mismatch deserialization] Does serde_json::from_value properly validate the CollectionData structure, or can malformed API responses cause silent field truncation or type coercion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: get_collection_data()] [Table handle spoofing] If the handle was tampered with, does the get_table_item call validate that the returned data actually belongs to the queried collection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: get_token_data()] [TokenDataId construction] The TokenDataId is constructed with creator.to_hex_literal() - can this format mismatch with Move's expected format causing lookup failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: get_token_data()] [Collection name encoding] Are collection and token names properly UTF-8 validated, or can invalid UTF-8 sequences cause deserialization errors or security bypasses? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: get_token_data()] [Type string validation] The type strings

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: get_token()] [Property version hardcoded] property_version is hardcoded to U64(0) - can tokens with different property versions be accessed, or does this create an information disclosure vulnerability? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: get_token()] [Account vs creator confusion] The function takes both account and creator parameters - can an attacker swap these to query tokens they don't own? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: get_token()] [TokenId structure] Does the TokenId serialization match the Move module's expected format exactly, or can field order differences cause lookup failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: offer_token()] [Amount overflow] Can the amount parameter overflow when added to existing token amounts in the receiver's account, allowing attackers to mint unlimited tokens? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: offer_token()] [Zero amount transfer] Can amount=0 be used to create phantom offers that consume gas and clog offer storage without transferring value? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: offer_token()] [Receiver validation] Does the function validate that the receiver address is not a system address or the sender's own address, preventing burns or self-transfers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: offer_token()] [Property version mismatch] Can an attacker offer tokens with a mismatched property_version, transferring the wrong token variant and causing recipient confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: offer_token()] [Insufficient balance check] Does the Move module check that account has sufficient token balance before creating the offer, or can offers exceed owned amounts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: offer_token()] [Duplicate offer attack] Can multiple offers be created for the same token to the same receiver, allowing the attacker to lock tokens in pending state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: claim_token()] [Sender spoofing] Can the sender parameter be manipulated to claim tokens from an offer not intended for the claiming account? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: claim_token()] [Creator manipulation] Can an attacker change the creator parameter to claim a different token with the same collection/name but different creator? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: claim_token()] [Property version bypass] Can property_version be set to a different value to claim a token variant not actually offered? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: claim_token()] [Double claim attack] Does the Move module properly delete offers after claiming, or can the same offer be claimed multiple times leading to token duplication? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Function: claim_token()] [Collection name injection] Can the collection/name parameters bypass Move module validation to claim tokens from different collections? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Struct: TransactionOptions] [Default gas too low] The default max_gas_amount of 5,000 may be insufficient for complex token operations - can this cause legitimate transactions to fail with out-of-gas errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/tokenv1_client.rs] [Struct: TransactionOptions] [Gas unit price manipulation] The default gas_unit_price of 100 - can attackers consistently use lower values to front-run transactions by setting higher prices? (Medium)
